intro: Kelleronia nogalensis, commonly known as the Mexican orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its intricate and delicate floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and come in a range of colors, including white, yellow, and orange. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Kelleronia nogalensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
